item.title: Report E-2024050192
item.description:
Report E-2024050192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-13T15:12:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-01
  • City: ROMEOVILLE
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ROADRUNNER TRANSPORTATION SYSTEMS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 1, 2024, at 1917 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, Illinois regarding the release of approximately (1) gallon of Magnum K (UN3266, 8, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed that the release was caused by a puncture to the drum and contained to a small area of the dock floor under the pallet. Terminal personnel placed absorbents on the release prior to the contractorâ€™s arrival. Contractors placed the damaged drum containing product in a 95-gallon plastic overpack. Contractors then neutralized and collected the spent absorbents with the proper PPE. All waste generated was placed in (1) 55-gallon DF, and (1) 95-gallon overpack DF and staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.
